column2: ALASKA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Alaska
column6: AK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Upside-down triangle
column6: Pennant

column2: 2. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 3. The minimum jail time you will get in a first conviction for DUI is:
column4: 10 days.
column6: 20 days.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Lane shifting
column6: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 5. The yield sign means:
column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column6: Stop.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 6. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: School ahead.
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 7. If your wheels drop off the pavement onto the shoulder of the road, you should:
column4: maintain your current speed and turn onto the pavement.
column6: slow down and carefully turn back onto the pavement.
column8: stop your car on the side of the road.
column10: immediately come to a complete stop, then quickly turn back onto the pavement.

column2: 8. This sign means drivers must not pass other vehicles:
column4: unless it is safe to do so.
column6: within 250 feet of this sign.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a winding road.
column6: a low place in the road.

column2: 10. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 11. A conviction of reckless driving will result in:
column4: a warning for the first conviction, and a $50 fine for the second.
column6: revocation of your driving license.
column10: a $125 fine and 4 points on your record.

column2: 12. When you are driving, turning your head and looking before changing lanes is:
column4: a good driving habit.
column6: unnecessary, you should use your rearview mirror instead.

column2: 13. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: reduce the reaction distance.
column8: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 14. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: On slippery roads.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 15. An arrow painted on the roadway means:
column4: Drivers must come to a complete stop, and then make the movement indicated by the arrow
column6: Drivers may make the movement indicated by the arrow
column8: Drivers must only make the movement indicated by the arrow when traffic signals are not working
column10: Drivers must make the movement indicated by the arrow

column2: 16. BAC is expressed in:
column4: percentage of alcohol to blood.
column6: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 17. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: if it’s raining.
column6: BEFORE you move.
column10: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 18. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how fit you are.
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 19. Under Alaskan law, seat belts are required:
column4: only for children under the age of 16.
column6: only for passengers under the age of 21.
column8: for everyone in the vehicle at all times.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column6: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column10: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
